basic.description:
Introduces descriptive and inferential statistics and data analysis strategies.   Topics include probability, correlation/regression, experimental design and analysis of variance.   Online learning and weekly laboratories provide practice in computation, interpretation and communication of statistical findings, and large class review sessions and individual drop in assistance ensure mastery.   Applications appropriate to different fields of study will be explored.
NOTE    Enrollment is limited. Priority will be given to students registered in BIOL Major (Science); BIOL, BIMA, BIPS, EBIO Specialization (Science) Plans.
RECOMMENDATION    12U Functions and 12 U Calculus or equivalent high school background or MATH 006/3.0.
basic.subject: BIOL
basic.title: Introduction to Statistics

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Exclusion  No more than 3.0 units from BIOL243; CHEE209; ECON250; GPHY247; KNPE251 (formerly PHED 251); NURS323; POLS385; PSYC202; SOCY211; STAT263; STAT267; STAT367; COMM162.
One-way Exclusion   May not be taken with or after STAT269.
